etymology.description: semantic: 艹 (grass, plant) + phonetic: 癸
etymology.interpretation: This character combines the grass radical 艹, which indicates its relation to plants, with the phonetic element 癸, suggesting its pronunciation. 葵 represents a plant, specifically associated with sunflowers or other similar plants.

examples.chinese: 葵花在阳光下绽放(葵花在陽光下綻放)。
那家糕点铺出售各种植物蛋糕，如艾糕、荠菜糕、葵糕(那家糕點鋪出售各種植物蛋糕，如艾糕、薺菜糕、葵糕)。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiā gāodiǎn pù chūshòu gèzhǒng zhíwù dàngāo, rú ài gāo, jìcài gāo, kuí gāo.
examples.english: The pastry shop sells various plant-based cakes, such as mugwort cake, shepherd’s purse cake, and mallow cake.

examples.chinese: 葵花籽富含油脂，是一种重要的食用和工业用油料(葵花籽富含油脂，是一種重要的食用和工業用油料)。
examples.pinyin: Kuíhuāzǐ fùhán yóuzhī, shì yī zhǒng zhòngyào de shíyòng hé gōngyè yòng yóuliào.
examples.english: Sunflower seeds are rich in oil, making them an important edible and industrial oil seed.
